page.title: 07GULF OIL REFINERY
page.content:
In the 1950's the population of Milford Haven was declining, but in the 1960's the oil companies arrived taking full advantage of the deep water channel to enable crude oil carriers of around 250,000dwt to enter {Gulf Refinery,}opened in{1968}by the Queen, now covers about 460 acres; the{processing plant}is a small area, most of the site is taken up by 80 {storage tanks.}Some of this tankage holds crude oil, some, products being refined and others, finished products ready for transporting. Most of the products leave by{sea,}but some are moved by{pipeline}or{rail.} The refinery produces many products including petrol for cars, diesel oil and heating oils.
by Anna-Jane Clarke
